question: 1 (a)
sols_html:
If we simply spit the fraction in two, we obtain simple terms that we an easily integrate.

\[\begin{aligned} \int \frac{3+x^5}{\sqrt{x}}\,dx &=\int 3x^{-1/2}+x^{9/2} \,dx\\ &= 6x^{1/2}+ \frac{2}{11}x^{11/2} +C\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
If we simply spit the fraction in two, we obtain simple terms that we an easily integrate.
:<math>\begin{align}
\int \frac{3+x^5}{\sqrt{x}}\,dx &=\int 3x^{-1/2}+x^{9/2} \,dx\\
&= 6x^{1/2}+ \frac{2}{11}x^{11/2} +C
\end{align} </math>
